DataElement.preferredName: Tooth Periodontal Pocket Greater Than Three Millimeter Present Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar, with an abnormal deepening of a gingival sulcus of relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status that is a natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one in a unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter (NCI) being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time, to determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar.

Concepts.definition: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.

Concepts.definition: An abnormal deepening of a gingival sulcus associated with destruction of the supporting periodontal tissue.
